result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron Michael Hansen

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 12, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

10:46 AM Defendant Aaron Michael Hansen in court.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Aaron Michael Hansen.  Prosecuting attorney Aleksandra Hodowany in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court addresses request for bond modification. Defense requests alcohol monitoring be removed.  State has no objection.  Victim makes statement.  Court grants request, modifies bond.
Court lifts pretrial release monitoring - Alcohol monitoring.  All other conditions remain in effect as previously set.

10:46 AM Defendant Aaron Michael Hansen in court.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Aaron Michael Hansen.  Prosecuting attorney Aleksandra Hodowany in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at. Atty Reetz indicates not resolved, requests another status.  State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 10:45 am.

10:15 AM   Defendant Aaron Michael Hansen appeared by phone.  Attorney Brett E Reetz not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews events in file, advises Atty Reetz is in the middle of a medical emergency, indicates matter will have to be rescheduled.  New date given to defendant.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 10:45 am.

Pretrial Release Monitoring Program: Must be enrolled and equipment activated prior to release. Alcohol Monitoring - Low Level.  No contact direct or indirect with  I.D.R., their children, her residence or her place of employment.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol.

11:51 AM  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Aaron Michael Hansen in court.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Aaron Michael Hansen.   Court reviews events in file, reviews defendant's request to remove the SCRAM bracelet.  State indicates victim opposes request, wouldn't have a problem with reducing to low level vs high level.  Defense would like to see SCRAM removed but will settle for low level monitoring for now.  Court amends Pre-Trial Release Monitoring condition of alcohol monitoring from high level to low level.  All other conditions remain as previously set.
Bail/bond hearing on August 15, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Motion to Modify Bond Alcohol Monitoring.            Pamela: Schedule this for a hearing. Call Reetz's office. 1:00 sometime this week? DTE
Status conference on September 1, 2022 at 10:15 am.

3:15 PM  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Aaron Michael Hansen in court.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Aaron Michael Hansen. Victim appears by zoom.  Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  Atty Reetz advises matter is not resolved, negotiations continue with the State.  State has no objection to adjournment.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 10:15 am.
for Victim as requested by DA's office
Status conference on July 14, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

Court lifts Pre-Trial Release Monitoring Program requirement of GPS monitoring ONLY.  Alcohol monitoring at the high level remains in effect. No contact direct or indirect with I.D.R., their children, her residence or her place of employment remains in effect as does maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol.

2:30 PM  Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Aaron Michael Hansen in court.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Aaron Michael Hansen.  Court reviews events in file, reviews Defendant's motion to lift the GPS monitor as condition of bond.  State opposes request, makes statement on bond modification. Atty Reetz gives argument.  Court makes statement, lifts Pre-Trial Release Monitoring condition of GPS monitoring ONLY.  All other conditions of bond remain in effect as previously set.
Bail/bond hearing on June 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond.             Pamela: Schedule this on for a hearing for later next week. DTE

Reetz Letter to Court re defendant change of address
Status conference on July 14, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Court adds Pre-Trial Monitoring condition of Alcohol Monitoring at a high level.  GPS monitoring remains in effect as does the no contact with I.D.R. and absolute sobriety.

Atty Reetz request bond be modified adding the alcohol monitor as part of Pre-Trial Release monitoring.  State has no objection, requests alcohol monitoring at the high level.  Court amends bond adding alcohol monitoring at a high level.  All other conditions remain as previously set.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains in effect.

10:30 AM   Defendant Aaron M Hansen in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Aaron M Hansen.  Attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file.  Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 4/17/22.

Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Pretrial Release Monitoring Program: Must be enrolled and equipment activated prior to release. GPS Monitoring. No contact direct or indirect with I.D.R., her residence or place of employment and no contact with their minor children,

11:30 AM Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Aaron Michael Hansen appeared by video from the Door County Jail. Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel.  Court indicates Atty Viel had stopped in before the hearing to advise defendant does not qualify for SPD representation.  Defendant requests time to retain an attorney or fill out petition for court appointed attorney.  Court questions defendant on address/employment.  Bond set.  Court will send petition for appointment of counsel form down with defendant.  If defendant wishes to go that route, he's to fill out form and file it with the court before his next hearing.  .
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
